_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc.
Felda, FL 33930
RMP Facility ID: New RMP Facility March 2006
Submission Receipt Date: New RMP Submission March 2006
 
RMP Executive Summary

Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc. is a chemical sales and distribution company located on North Highway 29 in Felda, Florida.  Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc. sells chemicals, including Chlorine Gas, to water and wastewater treatment plants, farms, nurseries, and other retail customers.  

Gaseous chlorine is delivered to the plant in 150-pound cylinders.  Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc. typically has twenty (20) to forty (40) 150-pound cylinders on the premises at any given time (approximately 3000 to 6000 pounds).  Cylinders are stored on site inside of the main warehouse.  Cylinders are chained to the wall, where they remain until they are sold and loaded on a truck for delivery to the customer.


WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO

The worst-case release scenario implemented in this RMP is breaking off the valve stem of a 150-pound chlorine cylinder while loading or unloading trucks.  The worst-case gas release discussed in this RMP is unlikely because cylinders are stored with caps on and operating procedures are in place and followed for safe loading and unloading of cylinders.  

ALTERNATIVE CASE RELEASE SCENARIO

The alternative case release scenario discussed in this RMP is a gas leak from accidental puncture of the cylinder with a forklift.  This scenario is unlikely because cylinders are chained to the wall and stored in an area of the warehouse where forklift traffic is minimal.  All staff are trained to handle cylinders by hand or with a hand-truck whenever possible versus using a forklift.   

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc. has not had an accidental release in the past five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc. Staff will respond and correct small controllable chlorine leaks ONLY.

Small c

ontrollable leaks are:
A. Leaking valve

 
The emergency responses for the above conditions are:
A. Notify warehouse manager and or owner.  
B. Put on the required Personnel Protective Equipment (PPE)
C. Implement the Buddy System if possible.
E. Turn the chlorine cylinder(s) off at the main cylinder valve.
F. Exit the area, close all doors.
G. Wait for the atmosphere to return to normal.

Staff will NOT CORRECT the following chlorine leaks:

A. Large and uncontrollable (ex. melted fuse plug, hole in the wall of a cylinder, cylinder valve broken off).
B. Leak situations where staff feel unsafe and unsure of the situation.

The emergency responses for the above conditions are:
A. Call EMERGENCY CONTROL CENTER ? Dial 911, 
1. Report the TYPE OF GAS leak emergency (Chlorine Gas leak emergency),
2. Report YOUR NAME,
3. Report Location: Paramount Chemicals & Plastics, Inc.
4. Report Address: 540 North Highway 29, Felda, Florida 33930.
5. Report Phone Number: 863-674-1800 or cellular telephone number or other telephone number being used in emergency situation.

B. Evacuate the facility as shown on the Emergency Evacuation Route

C. Notify warehouse manager and or owner.
